snippet.textDisplay:
It just simply never worked, It always refused, I couldn't so much as open it. ePSXe and DOSBox are the two emulators I have this problem with, they say they can't run and then they close.

My Brother had a similar problem on his and was able to fix it but wasn't able to do the same with mine.
snippet.textOriginal:
It just simply never worked, It always refused, I couldn't so much as open it. ePSXe and DOSBox are the two emulators I have this problem with, they say they can't run and then they close.

My Brother had a similar problem on his and was able to fix it but wasn't able to do the same with mine.

snippet.textDisplay:
I have the slight feeling that you have no clue what you are talking about...
ePSXe for instance (with the right plugins), is able to render any game on pretty much any resolution you want it to be, with several different post processing filters (Cel Shading, Bump Mapping, Bloom etc), get rid of the PSXs native clipping / geometry problems, enhance sound quality, render games at a fixed framerate, even though the console itself tended to stutter etc.

To say, that this emulator is of "terrible quality" can only come from someone with no clue what he is actually talking about.
Also, let me give you a tip:
Being made with a 32bit OS in mind has nothing to do with it whatsoever...

And it does run an everything, from a 32bit XP OS up to a 64bit Win8 OS without any problems.
If you cant even get it to work with a step by step tutorial, i wonder how youre able to write on YT on your own, as setting up eSPXe is no whitchcraft.
snippet.textOriginal:

To say, that this emulator is of "terrible quality" can only come from someone with no clue what he is actually talking about.
Also, let me give you a tip:

snippet.textDisplay: @ChaoticNarrative Yeah sorry man, your comp being a lappy and 64-bit has nothing to do with it. It took me a good 2-3 days to figure it all out when I first started using emulators.

snippet.textDisplay:
I myself started with 4, borrowed 3 from a friend, bought 5 tenth anniversarry edition, bought XF, bought 3, then got 1 & 2 for my PSP from the playstation online store. I wish to find Alter Code F, but I'm glad I got all the stories. ...Still need to check out the anime and manga though.
Oh, 3 had the best gameplay, but XF has the BEST story by FAR!!! I still love Weisheit!!! I want a prequel and a sequel for XF... play it and you'll see what I mean.
snippet.textOriginal:

Oh, 3 had the best gameplay, but XF has the BEST story by FAR!!! I still love Weisheit!!! I want a prequel and a sequel for XF... play it and you'll see what I mean.
